message.body: are you excited yet for GT Clemson
dude I am not feeling the reciprocating love on GT
you know we will steamroll them
can't wait for some optino football
I wonder if Jaybo Shaw will stay at QB
do you want to golf that saturday or just say screw it and watch football
because their starter Nesbitt should be back soon
it is a poss but I am leaning to just foosball
just football--cause when was the last time you and i watched all of GameDay together?
I'll bring the rope to tie up Klife in the basement
i put a mickey in her drink friday night
do you know what you are doing this weekend yet?
what time does your party that saturday start?
2006 season: Jamie Moyer, acquired Aug. 19 from Seattle with cash for Andrew Baldwin and Andrew Barb.

keep these in mind: *Game 6: Dodgers at PHILLIES, Friday Oct. 17, FOX, 8:22 p.m
*Game 7: Dodgers at PHILLIES, Saturday Oct. 18, FOX, 8:22 p.m.
the game will def be on at the party
i'm going to see if my dad can get tix to one of the games
i think my mom might be in France that weekend. if so, i'm going to stay at my parents on friday night...then I'll come over in time for start of GameDay
It was their fourth straight divisional loss at the Linc, and they are just 2-8 against NFC East teams at home since 2005.
yeah, I am not a big fan but we can def get you a steak there
or we could Q some burgers/dogs
i just had a great idea
we should get Kristen and Erin a gift for a day spa or something
that way we can watch football all day and get them out of the house
but i like where your head is at
but I just mean in general
and if she starts cleaning and shit it is going to piss me off
dude, that's what the rope and roofies are for
don't worry, i'll be all nice to her and stuff to distract her
i hope texas wins on Saturday because that would setup Mizzou v. Texas
I hope clemson wins this week so that it sets up a bigger GT win
USF v SU game on the 18th is at Noon on ABC
may have to bring down the vizio
at least Gramatica sucks more than Akers
he single handedly ruined an amazing performance by bush
Bush is really good by the way
I also think they used him incorrectly last year trying to make him an inbetween the tackles kind of runner
my fantasy team is not going in the right direction
my fantasy team is a debacle
and of course I sat steve slaton
quan is out because of his stupid broken face
but it is tough to sit Cutler
he has like the second most points behind bush
why? is his team good? i forget
sweet--some of Joey's best players have byes
Teams are converting 62 percent of their third downs against the Orange.
I think this may be the worst team I have ever rooted for
almost losing to Northeastern is like the Sonics almost losing to Kansas NCAA team
or the Mariners almost losing to the Phils AAA team
and they have been REALLY bad for 3 years now
The big east is going to be SICK
imagine when the TV schedule comes out for next week
we'll have to print out a detailed plan

While the Orange gives up a lot of yards and a lot of points, they have been able to force some turnovers. They actually have a +1 turnover ratio. The Orange has forced 8 turnovers while only committing seven.

So, overall Syracuseâ€™s defense is horrible without a single player that merits any individual attention in this article. If West Virginia cannot rack up huge rushing numbers and several touchdowns against the Orange then something is wrong. But I think you can expect a big day Saturday from the Mountaineer offense.
Overall, this Syracuse team will likely be the worst team the Mountaineers face this season, including the Football Championship Division Villanova Wildcats.
not much i don't agree with
I dont know what to think
as far as now or later
article has nothing to do with this fire him now
what is your case for firing him now
i think there is no benefit to keeping him
let the co-D coordinator take over D and continue to suck
what if Browning says "thats my boy - he goes I go"
what do they go back to?
not sure but when GRob was first hired He tried to hire Browning away from Minn
and every year he has tried to get him
what if it turns off potential candidates to see GRob fired in the middle of a season
how does it accelerate the hiring process?
well then fire him but let him coach the rest of the year
what is the benefit of hiring him
just playing devils advocate a little b
i think the Ron Zook thing is the best way to go
what are the benefits of firing him
firing him--get the public off the back of the program
gives players opportunity to figure whether they want to transfer or not knowing that their will be a new coach
lets recruits know that GRob is definitely not the new coach
it completely kills recruiting for the time being - but it is dead at this point regardless
i guess my question would be: is there a negative to firing GRob right now?
and i don't think i see one
I think I am agreeing with you

there will be a bunch of speculation for current HCs and they may publicly decline their interest since it is the middle of the season whereas if it was after the season they would throw their hat in the ring
probably not a real scenario but who knows?
I wonder if Edsall will be interested
he took his name out of contention last time the job was open
but that could also be a PR move if you feel that you are not a top candidate
Remove yourself even though you feel like you are a real candidate just to save face and look like you are really committed to UConn
i don't think he would be
they have a good thing brewing at UConn
But he is a proud alum
and they are starting to get to the precipice where he could get a bigger job
you think he pulls a les miles
true--but if this was his dream job, he could have had it already
his only opportunity was last search
and I kind of feel like Gross was enamored with the Pete Carrol mold
I don't think Edsall was really ever considered (complete speculation)
cmon you have to agree that Gross was going that route dont you think
i mean that your theory could be totally correct that he wasn't really considered
I would feel so comfortable if he was hired
like I know we would be on the right path
not sure how high he could take us
but he would get us on track
we would certainly be competitive again
Peterson makes me feel warm and fuzzy too - but he just took over a thriving program
didnt really build from ground up
but has sustained success and taken to possibly higher highs
he signed their stud QB who everyone says is going to be really good
QB is lefty from Prosser, WA
he was washington player of the year
he'd also ahve stud contacts in WA, CA
his JR year in high school he threw 66 TDs and over 4600 yards
look at how young the B. State roster is:
he was the QB coach at Pitt back in the 90s
so he's been east coast with Big E ties
I thought of another name this morning
he was SO bad at Stanford
and he runs the West Coast offense
did pitt run the WC O?
they went 5-6 his first year at Stanford
The Cardinal will utilize four and five receivers in Walt Harris' West Coast Offense.
doing good things at Standford right away
i'd still take petersen and edsall first
standford cannot be your dream job
in that same breath neither can SU
I thought of him a couple weeks
we get so dirty so quick
he gets too much money for doing nothing on TV
we should get paper bags to wear over our heads for the SU game
Ok we are throwing some good names out
its petersen...which i like cause it is spelled weird
we need another sure bet though that will come here
need to research him some more
He was involved in recruiting 17 players on WKU's 2002 Division I-AA National Championship team. His father was a football coach for 18 years, including 14 years as Head Coach at Western Kentucky.
11-1 to years in a row at SD
I went to a game when my sister was in school htere
and I am being semi serious
my sister said they weren't even cool
like people kind of laughed at them at parties and stuff
Golden was PSU recruiting coordinator in 2000
lot of those guys didn't develop though
Zack Mills was probably the biggest name
yeah i put golden and Gill on my second tier
because he was an option QB
and black - which I think is a bonus if you are a good coach
had some good college players but nobody spectacular
talifero was the nickel back as a Frosh before his injury
dont you feel like there are so many good candidates this time rather than last?
or are we just more educated this time
and we are only considering gusy with HC experience
which i think we agree that we need
also candidates haven't been ruled out yet
golden coached under Tom O'brien as well
Al Golden had #10, 17, 25, and 14th ranked classes while at Virginia
the 2000 Class at PSU when Golden was RC was #6 according to Rivals
I figure we have to get somone good
this could be a blessing in disguise
we get a good coach and re-focus on our program
Scary stat: The Mizzou Tigers have 49 straight possessions without a three-and-out.
i am totally off the coordinator bandwagon
I am out - interviews and then home
